title: Ticket #766: Get rid of hard coded paths in Windows build scripts
description:
On Windows, many of the batch files that build the externals, batch files that build Condor itself (in /msconfig), and/or the scripts that build on Windows in NMI contain hard-coded paths. For instance, hard-coded paths to active perl and c:\temp are common idioms.

We need to remove this crud so Condor on Win32 builds like Condor on Unix - by using tools that are in the path at the start of the build process.
remarks:
Changes have been made to support updated location of pre-reqs. Given some of the constraints regarding the state of the environment the paths have been updated in set_vars and no abs paths exist in the various scripts. There are still a couple of hard dependencies that exist.

Hopefully all of this will be deprecated with future work on the build system. (e.g. CMake)
